data.title: Clayton County Public Schools
data.text:
Clayton County Public Schools (CCPS) announces that the fall athletic season is officially starting and will offer outstanding competitions in football, volleyball, softball, cross country, and flag football.

Read More about CCPS Shares Athletic Updates - It’s Time for Fall Sports

On Thursday, August 8, 2024, Clayton County Public Schools (CCPS) hosted a Business Partnership Luncheon in the Cafe’ of the Administration Complex at 1098 Fifth Avenue, Jonesboro, GA 30236.

Read More about CCPS Hosts 2024 Business Partnership Luncheon for Local Clayton County Business Owners

Dr. Jessie Goree, Chair of the Clayton County Board of Education and representative of District 3, is proud to announce a summit for Clayton County students and parents/guardians.

Read More about Male Involvement and Teen Summit - August 10, 2024

Excitement is building across Clayton County Public Schools (CCPS) as two of our very own high school bands, The Mighty Marching Tigers of Mundy’s Mill High School and The Mighty Marching Eagles of North Clayton High School, have been selected as finalists in the 4th Annual Great Atlanta High School Band Challenge!

Read More about Great Atlanta High School Band Challenge - Your Vote is Needed!

Clayton County Public Schools (CCPS) is excited to announce that Elite Scholars Academy (ESA) has been selected as a Cambridge Showcase School for the August 2024 - July 2027 cohort!

Read More about Elite Scholars Academy Selected as a Cambridge Showcase School

The Early Learning Pre-K Department proudly presents its monthly 2024 Parent Engagement for PreK (P.E.P.) Series.

Read More about The Early Learning Pre-K Department to Host “Ready, Set, Go!” Parent Engagement Virtual Workshop | Thursday, August 22, 2024

Please see attached a statement issued by Clayton County Public Schools leadership related to the sudden passing of Dr. Brian Davis, President and CEO of the Georgia Aquarium.

Read More about Statement by CCPS on the passing of Dr. Brian Davis

On Monday, August 5, Clayton County Public Schools (CCPS) Superintendent/CEO Dr. Anthony W. Smith joined the Clayton County Board of Education (CCBOE) in honoring students, teachers, community stakeholders, and administrators for a series of accomplishments as well as in recognition of special events!

Read More about CCPS Shares Board of Education Recognitions from August 5, 2024

Clayton County Public Schools (CCPS) is proud to share the attached announcement as it contains details of Board Appointments from the July 29, 2024 Clayton County Board of Education Work Session.

Read More about Board Appointments - August 5, 2024
